title.narrative: 4. BEHAVIOURAL CHANGE COMMUNICATION FORMNCAH

description.narrative: By 2022, individuals, families, service providers and communities adopt social norms and practices favourable to maternal, child and adolescent health., which contributes to Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change, Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change (Covid), Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: by 2022, Women of childbearing age, pregnant women, newborns, boys and girls under age 5 years and adolescents use quality health services at health facilities and in communities.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2022, individuals, families, service providers and communities adopt social norms and practices favourable to maternal, childand adolescent health.

description.narrative: The response to the COVID-19required a strong systematic multisectoral approach in collaboration with partners. The development and implementation of a crisis communication plan against anti-vaccine rumors, fake news, risks and community involvement made it possible to use several communication channels to educate 6,300,000 people on prevention and vaccination. The channels used are mainly community relays, U-Reporters and community radios, theater-forums and cinema-debate shows. These channels made it possible to reach a variety of target groups, including adults (men and women) and young people and adolescents (girls and boys) in and out of school. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:28/01/2022
